page.title: 16TOURISM
page.content: Shildon is the birthplace of railways and the District Council is keen to promote this as a tourist attraction. The line between Shildon and Darlington was the scene of the 150th anniversary celebrations in 1975 and the Hackworth Museum was established.It was Timothy Hackworth's cottage which was converted and the remains of the Soho Works are preserved as a monument to him as the father of the locomotive.A life size replica of the {Sans Pareil}engine is on display at the Soho Works museum. Darlington have a Railway Museum which they promote to encourage tourism and it is felt by Sedgefield District Council that the Heritage line passing through Shildon, the Hackworth Museum, together with tourist attractions in Weardale could be developed to attract visitors to this area.
